subject: Re: [junit] testing for compile errors
msgSnippet: ... I am not a Java 5 programmer, and do not play one on TV, but I d love to see an example of this where compiling or not compiling isn t blaringly obvious to
messageBody:
Jon Barrilleaux wrote:

> A while back I posted a question/suggestion about being able to test for
> compile-time erros. Such testing is especially important in the
> presence of java generics -- you want to be sure that some data types,
> such as in method parameters, compile correctly, but others result in a
> compile error. Testing these cases by hand defeats the whole purpose of
> unit testing.
>
> Is there any way to test for a compile time error in a JUnit test? Is
> this something that would be impossible to add?

I am not a Java 5 programmer, and do not play one on TV, but I'd love to
see an example of this where compiling or not compiling isn't blaringly
obvious to any competent person reading the code.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
